channel.title: mysql on 仲夏园
channel.description: Recent content in mysql on 仲夏园

item.title: MySQL show syntax and server status variables
item.description: SHOW Syntax SHOW has many forms that provide information about databases, tables, columns, or status information about the server. This section describes those following: 1SHOW {BINARY | MASTER} LOGS 2SHOW BINLOG EVENTS [IN 'log_name'] [FROM pos] [LIMIT [offset,] row_count] 3SHOW CHARACTER SET [like_or_where] 4SHOW COLLATION [like_or_where] 5SHOW [FULL] COLUMNS FROM tbl_name [FROM db_name] [like_or_where] 6SHOW CREATE DATABASE db_name 7SHOW CREATE EVENT event_name 8SHOW CREATE FUNCTION func_name 9SHOW CREATE PROCEDURE proc_name 10SHOW CREATE TABLE tbl_name 11SHOW CREATE TRIGGER trigger_name 12SHOW CREATE VIEW view_name 13SHOW DATABASES [like_or_where] 14SHOW ENGINE engine_name {STATUS | MUTEX} 15SHOW [STORAGE] ENGINES 16SHOW ERRORS [LIMIT [offset,] row_count] 17SHOW EVENTS 18SHOW FUNCTION CODE func_name 19SHOW FUNCTION STATUS [like_or_where] 20SHOW GRANTS FOR user 21SHOW INDEX FROM tbl_name [FROM db_name] 22SHOW MASTER STATUS 23SHOW OPEN TABLES [FROM db_name] [like_or_where] 24SHOW PLUGINS 25SHOW PROCEDURE CODE proc_name 26SHOW PROCEDURE STATUS [like_or_where] 27SHOW PRIVILEGES 28SHOW [FULL] PROCESSLIST 29SHOW PROFILE [types] [FOR QUERY n] [OFFSET n] [LIMIT n] 30SHOW PROFILES 31SHOW RELAYLOG EVENTS [IN 'log_name'] [FROM pos] [LIMIT [offset,] row_count] 32SHOW SLAVE HOSTS 33SHOW SLAVE STATUS [FOR CHANNEL channel] 34SHOW [GLOBAL | SESSION] STATUS [like_or_where] 35SHOW TABLE STATUS [FROM db_name] [like_or_where] 36SHOW [FULL] TABLES [FROM db_name] [like_or_where] 37SHOW TRIGGERS [FROM db_name] [like_or_where] 38SHOW [GLOBAL | SESSION] VARIABLES [like_or_where] 39SHOW WARNINGS [LIMIT [offset,] row_count] 40 41like_or_where: 42 LIKE 'pattern' 43 | WHERE expr If the syntax for a given SHOW statement includes a LIKE '*pattern*' part, '*pattern*' is a string that can contain the SQL % and _ wildcard characters.

item.title: MySQL Statement Syntax
item.description: DATABASE ALTER DATABASE Syntax 1ALTER {DATABASE | SCHEMA} [db_name] 2 alter_specification ... 3 4alter_specification: 5 [DEFAULT] CHARACTER SET [=] charset_name 6 | [DEFAULT] COLLATE [=] collation_name 7 | DEFAULT ENCRYPTION [=] {'Y' | 'N'} ALTER DATABASE enables you to change the overall characteristics of a database. These characteristics are stored in the data dictionary. To use ALTER DATABASE, you need the ALTER privilege on the database. ALTER SCHEMA is a synonym for ALTER DATABASE.

item.title: MySQL Replication 简介
item.description: Replication enables data from one MySQL database server (the master) to be copied to one or more MySQL database servers (the slaves). Replication is asynchronous by default; slaves do not need to be connected permanently to receive updates from the master. Depending on the configuration, you can replicate all databases, selected databases, or even selected tables within a database. Advantages of replication in MySQL include: Scale-out solutions - spreading the load among multiple slaves to improve performance.

item.title: MySQL 8.0 Supported Storage Engines
item.description: MySQL 8.0 Supported Storage Engines InnoDB: The default storage engine in MySQL 8.0. InnoDB is a transaction-safe (ACID compliant) storage engine for MySQL that has commit, rollback, and crash-recovery capabilities to protect user data. InnoDB row-level locking (without escalation to coarser granularity locks) and Oracle-style consistent nonlocking reads increase multi-user concurrency and performance. InnoDB stores user data in clustered indexes to reduce I/O for common queries based on primary keys.
